data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The final sentence of the instructions says to always face forward. The final sentence is: Take 9 steps right. So in reality, you always have to take steps backward. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
When you turn around, you would turn right. You would make a circle and turn around twice. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The starting point is the place where you start from. The instructions only tell you how many steps it takes to get to the starting point. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take 4 steps to get 1 step taken, you would eventually make it. If you take 5 steps to turn left, you would eventually make it. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you turn left, you go up a flight of steps to the left. In one step, you’ll take 10 steps to turn left and in another, you’ll take 9 steps to turn left and in another two steps, you’ll take 3 steps to turn around and in a third step, you’ll take 5 steps to return to the main path. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can’ t turn around and return to the starting point from where you started. So, the answer is no.

The first instructions calls for 8 steps. Thus, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you walk back to the starting point, you take 6 steps to come back. If you turn around, you take 8 steps to go back. Taking 8 steps, reverts to taking 6 steps. If you return in 2 steps, you are able to go back to the beginning of walking. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

People who always face forward and take 4 steps forward always return to their starting point. People who always face forward take 1 step left and take 2 steps forward. People who always face forward take 2 steps forward and take 3 steps forward. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You take 3 steps backwards and turn around. In order to finish turns, you take 2 steps backwards and then take 7 steps backwards. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Just because you said you are always facing forward does not mean there are no starting points. Taking 1 step backward does not mean you are always facing forward. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You cannot always return to the starting point. There are no steps you cannot return to. So, the answer is No.

If you always face forward you can return to the starting point. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

A person who always faces left is unable to take forward steps. Someone who always faces forward is able to take right and back steps. People who always face right revert to the original direction of take right and left. If you follow the instructions, you will always face left. So, the answer is no.

You can only stand and go back in one direction. You cannot stop and walk forward. So, the answer is No.

On the previous walk, you will take 8 steps in the direction you turned right. So, the answer is No.

Take 3 steps or 6 steps in any order. There are 10 steps in the first order, and in the next, 9 steps. There are 10 steps in the first order, and in the next, 3 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you take 7 steps, you get back to the starting point in 7 steps. Taking 19 steps, you get back to the starting point in 9 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

Turning around means the starting point is the opposite direction you are turning. If you are turning around for 1 step, you take 1 step. If you are turning around for 2 steps, you take 2 steps. If you are turning around for 7 steps, you take 7 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you turn right, you will get to where you started. If you turn right, you will go back to where you started. So, the answer is No.

You can only take 8 steps left. You can only take 7 steps on each side of the left turn. There are 4 ways to get backward. You can take 7 steps forward, 6 steps backward and 9 steps forward. So, the answer is Yes.

You turn around in this sequence while taking 5 steps right. The starting point turns around in steps right before going back to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

If you always face forward, you are always going forward. If you ever face backward, you are never going forward. So, the answer is yes.

If you take 4 steps, there is a 4 foot step. If you take 3 steps and put a step in each direction the number of steps increases by 4/10, so now there is a step in each direction. So, the answer is Yes.

To return to the starting point, one has to face forward and then return to the starting point. The answer is no.

There are seven steps plus seven steps = 21 steps. You cannot turn around and take a new step back in exactly the same sequence. If you take seven steps back on number 3, you cannot take 7 steps back again. So, the answer is Yes.

If you always face forward you can take any number of steps backward. If you take 5 steps backward then you would have taken 5 steps forward. If you take 4 steps backward then you would have taken 4 steps backward. The answer: No.

One must face forward to take a step backward. Having to face to the right of something does not have a positive or negative effect on the remaining steps in a direction. So, the answer is no.

To complete the instruction, you first have to face forward to orient yourself. If you always f ore forward to orient yourself, with the instruction set you would always start facing forward. If you constantly walk towards the right and back, with the instruction set you would always take the right and back and repeat. Take 3 steps forward and take 3 steps backward, and take 5 steps forward and take 3 steps backward. The sentence 1 states that the steps forward is to always be towards the right and the steps back is to always be to the left. The sentence 2 states that the steps backward are to always take the right and take the left. The sentence 3 states that the steps backward are to always take the left and take the right. So, the answer is yes.

Turn around is a general phrase that usually means the same thing as turns back around. The instructions for the instructions state you take 1-2 steps to the starting point and you take 10 steps to the starting point. So, the answer is no.

Face forward when you want to take your first step backward. Take 6 steps forward when you are facing forward. Take 4 steps forward when you are facing backward. Take 9 steps backward when you are facing right. So, the answer is Yes.

To go forward you should always be facing forward but to backward you should always be facing backward. To come back you should always be facing forward but to go toward the start you should always be facing the right way. So, the answer is yes.

The first set of steps takes you all the way backwards. On the second set, you're reversing where you started. The second set continues like this until you get to the starting point and then reversing where you started. So, the answer is no.

The first 5 steps backwards are always right if you always face forward. The first 5 steps forward are always left if you always face forward. The second 5 steps forward are always right and always take one step forward. The third 5 steps backwards are always left and always take one step backward. The fourth 5 steps right is always left if you always face left. The fifth 5 steps right is always right and always take one step forward. The sixth 5 steps left is always right if you always face right. So, the answer is yes.
